TEXT.TITLE: BELGIAN PRIME MINISTER DEFENDS AUSTERITY PROGRAM
TEXT.BODY: Belgian Prime Minister Wilfried Martens said government austerity programs adopted in the last six years had resolved some of the economy's urgent problems, but that unemployment remained a major obstacle. Martens told Belgian television the austerity measures had brought the country's balance of payments from deficit to surplus, helped reduce inflation and boosted economic growth. REUTER
